name: AMIT KUMAR
position: GMET @ Jaguar Land Rover | Aerospace Engineering | IIT KHARAGPUR
about: A cross-industrial enthusiast, finding ways to incorporate Artificial Intelligence in Core Mechanical Systems. Converting garbage data into something recyclable and reusable data for satisfying the appetite of machine learning model. In addition, innovating, researching, designing and developing cool mech products.

experience.title: Second Senate Member

experience.company: Meghnad Saha Hall of Residence, Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur

experience.title: Flight Controls Research Internship
experience.description: This Research Internship focused on developing Guidance Law for intercepting a target. During initial stages, reviewed literature and simulated them in MATLAB and Python. Later on, developed a PN Guidance Law to intercept a moving target in 2D space with constraints on terminal impact angle and look-angle.
experience.description_html: This Research Internship focused on developing Guidance Law for intercepting a target. During initial stages, reviewed literature and simulated them in MATLAB and Python. Later on, developed a PN Guidance Law to intercept a moving target in 2D space with constraints on terminal impact angle and look-angle. <!---->

experience.title: Project Engineering Intern
experience.description: This internship concentrated mainly on simulations of Contra-Rotating Propellers on CFX and Ansys. The work included looking out for optimum performance of propellers with different loading cases. Apart from this mesh independence was checked on Turbogrid 17.0 version of Ansys.

publications: [{"title":"Impact Angle Constrained Time-Optimal Guidance Law for Stationary Target Interception in 3D","subtitle":"Guidance, Navigation, and Control, AIAA Conference, San Diego","date":"January 5, 2022"},{"title":"Inverse Design of Airfoils Using Convolutional Neural Network and Deep Neural Network","subtitle":"Gas Turbine India Conference, ASME, Online","date":"December 15, 2021"},{"title":"Electric Propulsion System for Airavat - The Roadable Vehic","subtitle":"National Aerospace Propulsion Conference (NAPC), Bengaluru","date":"December 17, 2020"},{"title":"Shear Deformation of Ferro-Fluid Droplet under uniform Magnetic Field in a Hele-Shaw Cell","subtitle":"Proceedings of the 8th International and 47th National Conference on Fluid Mechanics and Fluid Power (FMFP)","description":"â€¢ Simulated the model of ferrofluid in Hele-Shaw cell in the presence of Magnetic field using inbuilt Magnetohydrodynamics module of ANSYS software.â€¢ Analyzed the behaviour of ferrofluid bubble in Hele-Shaw cell in the presence of various external Magnetic field using Image Processing Toolkit of MATLAB.â€¢ Calculated instantaneous position coordinates and velocity of the ferrofluid bubble in Hele-Shaw in presence of magnetic field using Image Processing Techniques."}]

projects.title: Digital Twin of Packed Bed Cryogenic Energy Storage System
projects.description: â€¢ Developed digital twin of CES System in MATLAB and Simulink which read data from sensors and mimicked the practical system with 0.05 error.â€¢ Solved PDE of heat exchange and analyzed the generated temperature profile of bed and fluid to enhance the accuracy and generalized the MATLAB code.â€¢ Processed the results to represent the effect of mass flow rate, alumina packed bed parameters graphically and analyzed it qualitatively and quantitatively.

projects.title: INSTITUTE CHALLENGE RESEARCH PROJECT
projects.description: This project involves designing and developing electrical propulsion system. The tasks which we look upon are designing of ducted fan consisting of contra rotating propellers and optimizing the engine performance.

projects.title: Path Detection of Launched Vehicle
projects.description: Under this project we focused on determining the trajectory of projected body using fourth order Runge Kutta Algorithm. The algorithm was used for solving the equations of motion of the projected body. We accurately determined the trajectory and its attribute considering flat earth in resisting atmosphere. We then extended it to the trajectory determination considering round earth and exponential density model of atmosphere.
